title: Instructional Design Based on Three-Tier Learning Levels for Educational Mechatronics and Robotics

context.prior_knowledge: Basic engineering concepts and programming experience
context.additional_context: Hands-on course for acquiring mechatronics and robotics concepts aligned with Industry 4.0 demands

learning_goals: At the concrete learning level, learners can explain the assembly and basic operations of a 3D-printed robotic arm.
At the representational learning level, learners can simulate robotic workspace modeling and kinematic concepts.
At the abstract learning level, learners can connect mechatronics systems to Industry 4.0 application cases.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
